subject: Photography
title: Patterns and Repetition
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Patterns and Repetition.

hook.text: A wall of identical windows. Rows of tulips. Repeating patterns are hypnotic â€” until something breaks them.

buildup.text: Repetition creates rhythm in photographs. The eye follows the pattern and finds comfort in its regularity.

discovery.text: The real power comes when a pattern is broken â€” one red flower among white ones. Disruption creates the story.

twist.text: Pure pattern is decorative. Broken pattern is dramatic. The break becomes the subject of the photograph.

climax.text: Nature and architecture overflow with patterns. Training your eye to see them transforms ordinary scenes.

punchline.text: Find the pattern. Then find what breaks it.

quiz.question: What makes a broken pattern compelling in photography?
options: The disruption becomes the focal point and creates a story
